fields_of_interest: Business and Industry, Research and innovation, Digital economy and society
eu_initiatives:
MADE is a non for profit organisation focusing on the practical implementation of research in industry through innovation and education. 
 
MADE follows the European discussions regarding the strengthening of the European manufacturing industry, for example Digitalization of industry and the development of Advanced Manufacturing capabilities.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
goals__remit:
MADE is an independent association that aims to facilitate the development of innovative world-class manufacturing solutions in Danish industry, enabling Denmark to compete globally and create employment within Denmark. 
 
MADE achieves its goals through the development of strategic partnerships between research institutes and industry, to deliver state of the art: manufacturing technology, leadership, operating models and education. 
 
MADE consists of more than 150 large and small manufacturing companies, five universities, three RTO's and is supported by private foundations and associations. MADE welcomes all production companies, education institutes and other interested parties who wish to develop Denmark's manufacturing capabilities.
relevant_communication: MADE is a KET-center, a member of the Factories of the Future program (EFFRA) and participates in Horizon 2020 projects.
